August 20 at 3:32 PM 路

LITCHFIELD ELEMENTARY STUDENTS DESIGN FACE-SHIELDS!
Litchfield's 1st and 2nd grade teacher is THE BEST! Mrs. (Breezy Sauer) Litchfield Sauer had her class create their own face shields in class. Here they are wearing the shields they created earlier in the day. Mrs. Sauer had personally bought some face-shields to wear in school but had a hunch she could make them for less. She spent $30 on 60 face-shields for the elementary. She bought foam and elastic at Hobby Lobby and used clear projector sheets for the shield. A little hot glue and some staples created a safer classroom. The student's favorite part are the stickers which helped the students identify their own masks and take ownership of their project. AN A+ INVENTION! Looking good 1st and 2nd! Photo credit goes to Sydnee Sweley!
